rule.q: Should developers have standing write access to production?

answer: Developers should not have standing write access to production. Changes must be tested in a non‑production environment prior to release.

citations.text: Developers should not have standing write access to production.
Changes must be tested in a non‑production environment prior to release.
All production changes must be peer‑reviewed and approved before deployment.
Emergency changes require documented post‑implementation review.

spans.text: Developers should not have standing write access to production. Changes must be tested in a non‑production environment prior to release.
All production changes must be peer‑reviewed and approved before deployment.
